  • Modified ASM2D Property Package
  • View page source

Modified ASM2D Property PackageÔÉÅ

This package is an extension of the base Activated Sludge Model no.2d (ASM2d) and implements properties and reactions of an activated sludge model for biological nutrient removal from wastewater using an activated sludge biological reactor with biological phosphorus removal as provided in Flores-Alsina, X. et al. (2016) [1].

Throughout this documentation, text in red has been removed in the Modified ASM2d model, text in lime has been added, and text in blue has been modified from its base ASM2d implementation.

The following modifications have been made to the base ASM2d model as provided in [1]:

  • adds inorganic carbon (S_IC), potassium (S_K), and magnesium (S_Mg) as solutes

  • removes total suspended solids (X_TSS), metal-hydroxides (X_MeOH), metal-phosphate (X_MeP), alkalinity (S_ALK), and any variables or parameters associated with alkalinity

  • removes the precipitation reaction (R20) and the re-dissolution reaction (R21)

  • updates the Petersen matrix based on the above changes

  • updates the rate expressions based on the above changes

This Modified Activated Sludge Model no.2D (ASM2D) property/reaction package:

  • supports ‚ÄòH2O‚Äô, ‚ÄòS_A‚Äô, ‚ÄòS_F‚Äô, ‚ÄòS_I‚Äô, S_N2, S_NH4, S_NO3, S_O2, S_PO4, S_K, S_Mg, S_IC, X_AUT, X_H, X_I, X_PAO, X_PHA, X_PP, and X_S as components

  • supports only liquid phase

ComponentsÔÉÅ

The modified ASM2D model includes 18 components as outlined in the table below. Red text indicates the component has been removed in the Modified ASM2d model, and lime text indicates the component has been added.

Description

Symbol

Name in Model

\(S_A\)

\(S_F\)

\(S_I\)

Dinitrogen, N2. SN2 is assumed to be the only nitrogenous product of denitrification

\(S_{N2}\)

S_N2

Ammonium plus ammonia nitrogen

\(S_{NH4}\)

S_NH4

Nitrate plus nitrite nitrogen (N03‚Äô + N02‚Äô -N); SN03 is assumed to include nitrate as well as nitrite nitrogen.

\(S_{NO3}\)

Process Rate EquationsÔÉÅ

Equations marked ‚Äú(with decay)‚Äù indicate that the decay of heterotrophs and autotrophs is dependent on the electron acceptor present. Equations marked ‚Äú(without decay)‚Äù indicate that the decay of heterotrophs and autotrophs does not change.

Red text indicates the equation has been removed in the Modified ASM2d model, and blue text indicates the equation has been modified from its base ASM2d implementation.

Description

Equation

Aerobic hydrolysis

\(œÅ_1 = K_{H}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KL_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{X_{S}/X_{H}}{KL_{X}+X_{S}/X_{H}})X_{H}\)

Anoxic hydrolysis

\(œÅ_2 = K_{H}Œ∑_{NO3}(\frac{KL_{O2}}{KL_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KL_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{X_{S}/X_{H}}{KL_{X}+X_{S}/X_{H}})X_{H}\)

Anaerobic hydrolysis

\(œÅ_3 = K_{H}Œ∑_{fe}(\frac{KL_{O2}}{KL_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{KL_{NO3}}{KL_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{X_{S}/X_{H}}{KL_{X}+X_{S}/X_{H}})X_{H}\)

Growth on fermentable substrates, S_F

\(œÅ_4 = ¬µ_{H}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{F}}{K_{F}+S_{F}})(\frac{S_{F}}{S_{F}+S_{A}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KH_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KH_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})X_{H}\)

Growth on fermentation products, S_A

\(œÅ_5 = ¬µ_{H}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{A}}{KH_{A}+S_{A}})(\frac{S_{A}}{S_{F}+S_{A}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KH_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KH_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})X_{H}\)

Denitrification with fermentable substrates, S_F

\(œÅ_6 = ¬µ_{H}hH_{NO3}(\frac{KH_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KH_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{S_{F}}{K_{F}+S_{F}})(\frac{S_{F}}{S_{F}+S_{A}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KH_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KH_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})X_{H}\)

Denitrification with fermentation products, S_A

\(œÅ_7 = ¬µ_{H}hH_{NO3}(\frac{KH_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KH_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{S_{A}}{KH_{A}+S_{A}})(\frac{S_{A}}{S_{F}+S_{A}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KH_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KH_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})X_{H}\)

Fermentation

\(œÅ_8 = q_{fe}(\frac{KH_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{KH_{NO3}}{KH_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{S_{F}}{K_{fe}+S_{F}})X_{H}\)

Lysis (without decay)

\(œÅ_9 = b_{H}X_{H}\)

Lysis (with decay)

\(œÅ_9 = b_{H}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})+hH_{NO3,end}(\frac{KH_{O2}}{KH_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KH_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})X_{H}\)

Storage of X_PHA

\(œÅ_{10} = q_{PHA}(\frac{S_{A}}{KP_{A}+S_{A}})(\frac{X_{PP}/X_{PAO}}{KP_{PP}+X_{PP}/X_{PAO}})X_{PAO}\)

Aerobic storage of X_PP

\(œÅ_{11} = q_{PP}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KP_{P}+S_{PO4}})(\frac{X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}}{KP_{PHA}+X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}})(\frac{K_{MAX} - X_{PP}/X_{PAO}}{K_{IPP}+K_{MAX} - X_{PP}/X_{PAO}})X_{PAO}\)

Anoxic storage of X_PP

\(œÅ_{12} = q_{PP}hP_{NO3}(\frac{KP_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KP_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KP_{P}+S_{PO4}})(\frac{X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}}{KP_{PHA}+X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}})(\frac{K_{MAX} - X_{PP}/X_{PAO}}{K_{IPP}+K_{MAX} - X_{PP}/X_{PAO}})X_{PAO}\)

Aerobic growth on X_PHA

\(œÅ_{13} = ¬µ_{PAO}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KP_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KP_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})(\frac{X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}}{KP_{PHA}+X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}})X_{PAO}\)

Anoxic growth on X_PHA

\(œÅ_{14} = ¬µ_{PAO}hP_{NO3}(\frac{KP_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KP_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KP_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KP_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})(\frac{X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}}{KP_{PHA}+X_{PHA}/X_{PAO}})X_{PAO}\)

Lysis of X_PAO (without decay)

\(œÅ_{15} = b_{PAO}X_{PAO}\)

Lysis of X_PAO (with decay)

\(œÅ_{15} = b_{PAO}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})+hP_{NO3,end}(\frac{KP_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KP_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})X_{PAO}\)

Lysis of X_PP (without decay)

\(œÅ_{16} = b_{PP}X_{PP}\)

Lysis of X_PP (with decay)

\(œÅ_{16} = b_{PP}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})+hPP_{NO3,end}(\frac{KP_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KP_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})X_{PP}\)

Lysis of X_PHA (without decay)

\(œÅ_{17} = b_{PHA}X_{PHA}\)

Lysis of X_PHA (with decay)

\(œÅ_{17} = b_{PHA}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})+hPHA_{NO3,end}(\frac{KP_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KP_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})X_{PHA}\)

Aerobic growth of X_AUT

\(œÅ_{18} = ¬µ_{AUT}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KA_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NH4}}{KA_{NH4}+S_{NH4}})(\frac{S_{PO4}}{KA_{PO4}+S_{PO4}})X_{AUT}\)

Lysis of X_AUT (without decay)

\(œÅ_{19} = b_{AUT}X_{AUT}\)

Lysis of X_AUT (with decay)

\(œÅ_{19} = b_{AUT}(\frac{S_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})+hAUT_{NO3,end}(\frac{KP_{O2}}{KP_{O2}+S_{O2}})(\frac{S_{NO3}}{KP_{NO3}+S_{NO3}})X_{AUT}\)

Precipitation of phosphorus with ferric hydroxide

\(œÅ_{20} = k_{PRE}S_{PO4}X_{MeOH}\)

Redissolution

\(œÅ_{21} = k_{RED}X_{MeP}(\frac{S_{ALK}}{K_{ALK}+S_{ALK}})\)

ScalingÔÉÅ

A thorough scaling routine for the ASM2D property package has yet to be implemented.

ReferencesÔÉÅ

Batstone, Modelling phosphorus (P), sulfur (S) and iron (Fe) interactions fordynamic simulations of anaerobic digestion processes, Water Research. 95 (2016) 370-382. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0043135416301397
